titleStmt.title: W. N. Sweeney et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5664

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos. Bramlette Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
The Petition of the sender signed respectfully sheweth that at the August Term 1863 of the Daviess Circuit Court the Commonwealth received judgment against B CW. Murphy for the sum of $200. for

Mr. Murphy is a poor man & for the last year has been a Cripple -- is so still & barely able to get about -- He has not the means to pay the judgement & unless Executive Clemency interpose must go to jail -- He has a family of small Children who are dependant upon the little he can do, for their Support -- without advising as to the facts upon which the indictment & Verdict were based -- we do not Know them, we have no hesitation, knowing the man as we do & his condition, to recommend him, to the favorable Consideration of yr. Excellency & to ask that the fine be remitted --

Geo W Swope.
John O Brien Clk cty ct
J. H. Blair
Ed. T. White
J W Compton
J P Marlowe
W. B. Tyler Cashier
Jos W Car
W. N. Sweeney
E S Ayers
Danl. M. Griffith
Jo. G. Harrison Shff.
J. D. Shepherd
C S. Todd
John H, McHenry
Jesse Moore PM
J. H, Brannon
Joesph Thomas, Circt Clk
J M Bodine C S C
James J Norris

Daviess Cir Ct
vs
Remit $100
half the fine
B. C. Murphey
12th July/64
